title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. title: Contributing to OSD758
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to OSD758
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("patterninstitute/OSD758", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

what: Artificial Gravity Attenuates the Transcriptomic Response to Spaceflight in the Optic Nerve and Retina
title: Artificial Gravity Attenuates the Transcriptomic Response to Spaceflight in the Optic Nerve and Retina
text: OSD758 R data package provides compact, real-world example dataset illustrating RNA-seq analysis workflows using DESeq2 package R. includes sample metadata raw normalized gene expression counts derived optic nerve retinal tissues mice subjected varying levels artificial gravity spaceflight. dataset, originally published NASA’s Open Science Data Repository (OSD-758), offers biologically meaningful technically appropriate starting point teaching, demonstration, method development differential gene expression analysis.

title: Artificial Gravity Attenuates the Transcriptomic Response to Spaceflight in the Optic Nerve and Retina

what: OSD758: Artificial Gravity Attenuates the Transcriptomic Response to Spaceflight in the Optic Nerve and Retina — OSD758-package
title: OSD758: Artificial Gravity Attenuates the Transcriptomic Response to Spaceflight in the Optic Nerve and Retina — OSD758-package
text: Provides sample metadata, raw counts, normalized transcriptomic data NASA-funded experiment examining effects artificial gravity ocular tissues spaceflight. dataset originates Open Science Data Repository study OSD-758, includes RNA-seq profiles mouse optic nerve retina following exposure varying gravity levels aboard International Space Station. package enables streamlined access analysis data reproducible research teaching space biology, transcriptomics, gravitational physiology. Source: https://doi.org/10.26030/d6dj-d777.

what: Sample metadata table for RNA-seq experiment aboard ISS and on Earth — samples
title: Sample metadata table for RNA-seq experiment aboard ISS and on Earth — samples
text: samples() returns metadata table 35 mouse retina samples collected spaceflight experiment conducted aboard International Space Station (ISS) matched ground-based controls Earth. includes key information biological specimen, experimental condition, physical acceleration environment mice housed mission.

title: Sample metadata table for RNA-seq experiment aboard ISS and on Earth — samples
Sample metadata table for RNA-seq experiment aboard ISS and on Earth — samples
text: tibble 35 rows 9 columns: sample_id Unique identifier RNA-seq sample. Encodes group replicate. organism Biological species. samples Mus musculus (mouse). sex Sex animal. samples dataset male mice. matrix Biological matrix RNA extracted. dataset, samples right retina. spacecraft platform habitat mouse housed: "ISS" — aboard International Space Station. "Earth" — ground-based control comparable conditions. Note term "spacecraft" used denote physical environment supporting life experiment, including ground controls. acceleration_source Describes physical mechanism mouse experienced gravitational acceleration: "Terrestrial Gravity" — natural 1G gravity Earth's surface due planetary mass. "Centrifugal Acceleration" — artificial gravity generated rotating mouse habitat centrifuge aboard ISS. "Orbital Free Fall" — near-weightlessness resulting continuous free fall orbit (commonly referred microgravity). variable separates mechanism experienced acceleration platform (spacecraft). gravity Numeric representation effective gravitational acceleration (multiples Earth gravity, G) experienced sample. Values include: 1 — either terrestrial 1G 1G simulated via centrifuge ISS. 0.66 0.33 — partial gravity simulated adjusting centrifuge speed. 0.000001 — represents orbital free fall (proxy microgravity). Although gravitational pull still ~90% Earth’s ISS altitude, reflects net effective acceleration free-fall frame. variable supports quantitative modeling gravity-dependent effects. weight_at_launch Body weight animal time launch (analogous time point ground controls), grams. weight_at_euthanasia Body weight animal euthanasia, grams. Used assess weight changes across experimental conditions.

title: Sample metadata table for RNA-seq experiment aboard ISS and on Earth — samples
code: samples() #> # A tibble: 35 × 9 #>    sample_id        organism sex   matrix spacecraft acceleration_source gravity #>    <chr>            <chr>    <fct> <chr>  <fct>      <fct>                 <dbl> #>  1 MHU-8_RTN_FLT_F… Mus mus… male  Right… ISS        Centrifugal Accele…  3.3e-1 #>  2 MHU-8_RTN_FLT_F… Mus mus… male  Right… ISS        Centrifugal Accele…  6.6e-1 #>  3 MHU-8_RTN_FLT_F… Mus mus… male  Right… ISS        Centrifugal Accele…  1  e+0 #>  4 MHU-8_RTN_FLT_F… Mus mus… male  Right… ISS        Orbital Free Fall    1  e-6 #>  5 MHU-8_RTN_FLT_F… Mus mus… male  Right… ISS        Centrifugal Accele…  3.3e-1 #>  6 MHU-8_RTN_FLT_F… Mus mus… male  Right… ISS        Centrifugal Accele…  6.6e-1 #>  7 MHU-8_RTN_FLT_F… Mus mus… male  Right… ISS        Centrifugal Accele…  1  e+0 #>  8 MHU-8_RTN_FLT_F… Mus mus… male  Right… ISS        Orbital Free Fall    1  e-6 #>  9 MHU-8_RTN_FLT_F… Mus mus… male  Right… ISS        Centrifugal Accele…  3.3e-1 #> 10 MHU-8_RTN_FLT_F… Mus mus… male  Right… ISS        Centrifugal Accele…  6.6e-1 #> # ℹ 25 more rows #> # ℹ 2 more variables: weight_at_launch <dbl>, weight_at_euthanasia <dbl>
